naslov: Kamena kuća u Selcima otok Brač-a stone house in Selca, island Brač (prodaja)
Mogućnost zamjene: Nije moguća zamjena za drugu nekretninu
opis: The old stone house which was built in 1932 and has its own well is located in the same street as the Church of Our Lady of Mount Carmel from the 18th century and near numerous cultural monuments that make Selca the village with the highest number of monuments per capita in the world. Among them are Lav Nikolayevich Tolstoy, Franjo Tuđman, Hans Dietrich Genscher, Alois Mock, Pope John Paul II, and a handful of others scattered throughout the village. Of the 30 memorial plaques, the one that stands out is on the house where Martin Kukučin (Martin Bencur), a doctor and the founder of modern Slovak prose, lived and worked. He wrote, among other things, about the life of islanders in their homeland and in emigration. The Church of Christ the King, also known as the Brač Cathedral due to its size, is located in the center of the village. Selca is situated on the plateau of Mount Pliš, in the eastern part of the island of Brač, and was first mentioned in the 1184 in the Povaljska Charter. One of the attractions near Selca is the stunning Skywalk Biokovo, located just 25 km away on the main land and the local airport Brač is 17km away. The plot is 129sqm. It is located in the centre of Selca, a 30-minute walk to the beach. Type of the house  Detached Number of floors  Ground floor Type of material  Stone house Number of rooms  One Living area   65 sqm Backyard           64 sqm Construction date         1932. It requires complete renovation. Rightful ownership Contact phone 385 98 202 516 Stara kamena kuća izgrađena 1932. godine koja ima i vlastiti bunar nalazi se u istoj ulici kao i Crkva Gospe Karmelske iz 18. stoljeća te u blizini mnogobrojnih spomenika kulture koji Selca čine selom s najvećim brojem spomenika po glavi stanovnika u svijetu. Nalaze se tu Lav Nikolajević Tolstoj, Franjo Tuđman, Hans Dietrich Genscher, Alois Mock, papa Ivan Pavao II i nekolicina drugih razasutih po cijelom selu. Od 30 spomen ploče ističe se ona na kući gdje je živio i radio Martin Kukučin (Martin Bencur), doktor i utemeljitelj moderne slovačke proze koji je između ostaloga pisao i o životu otočana u domovini i u iseljeništvu. Crkva Krista Kralja, poznata i kao Bračka katedrala zbog svoje veličine, nalazi se u centru sela. Selca su smještena na visoravni brda Pliša, na istočnom dijelu otoka Brača, a prvi puta se spominju davne 1184. godine u dokumentu Povaljskoj listini. Od znamenitosti u blizini Selaca nalazi se zadivljujuća Nebeska šetnica ili Skywalk Biokovo iznad Makarske udaljena svega 25km, a od Zračne luke Brač svega 17km. Tip kuće                  Samostojeća Broj etaža          Prizemnica Vrsta kuće          Kamena Stambena povrsina         65 m2 Površina okucnice         64 m2 Godina izgradnje            1932 Kuča zahtjeva kompletnu renovaciju. Vlasništvo uredno nema tereta. Kontakt 385 98 202 516
